item.title: Python Basics 1
item.description: Download available at My Github Page First, load the dataset faithful. import pandas as pd faithful=pd.read_csv("https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/csv/datasets/faithful.csv") x=faithful type(x) Check the dataset by loading the first five rows. faithful.head()

item.title: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: library(knitr) hook_output = knit_hooks$get('output') knit_hooks$set(output = function(x, options) { # this hook is used only when the linewidth option is not NULL if (!is.null(n <- options$linewidth)) { x = knitr:::split_lines(x) # any lines wider than n should be wrapped if (any(nchar(x) > n)) x = strwrap(x, width = n) x = paste(x, collapse = '\n') } hook_output(x, options)}) ```{R eval=F} data(package = .packages(all.available = TRUE)) #0. Introduce your dataset and each of your variables (or just your main variables if you have lots) in a paragraph.

item.title: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: library(knitr) hook_output = knit_hooks$get('output') knit_hooks$set(output = function(x, options) { # this hook is used only when the linewidth option is not NULL if (!is.null(n <- options$linewidth)) { x = knitr:::split_lines(x) # any lines wider than n should be wrapped if (any(nchar(x) > n)) x = strwrap(x, width = n) x = paste(x, collapse = '\n') } hook_output(x, options)}) ```{R eval=F} data(package = .packages(all.available = TRUE)) #0. Introduce your dataset and each of your variables (or just your main variables if you have lots) in a paragraph.

item.title: Data Wrangling and Exploratory Analysis
item.description: knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE) library(knitr) opts_chunk$set(fig.align="center", fig.height=5, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=8, tidy=TRUE) ##0 Introduction getwd() performance<-read.csv("exam.csv",TRUE,",") medicalcost<-read.csv("insurance.csv",TRUE,",") The first dataset is about student performance in three different(subjects) exams along with parental education level and completion of test preparation. The second dataset is about individual's medical cost charged by healthcare insurance companies. As I'm interested in healthcare and medicine, I'd like to know if there is any interesting relationship between student's performance and the cost of insurance with consideration of factors like economic, personal, and social.

item.title: About „Öá„ÖÅ„Öà
item.description: Hi there! My name is Min Jo Lee or Andrew; either works! I study Computational Biology and Business Healthcare at the University of Texas at Austin. I'm currently learning how to incorporate knowledge and skills of Data Science into Healthcare and Medicine. Other than academic work, I play or watch soccer and enjoy writing film reviews. üìÑ üèÜ üî¨ üá∞üá∑ Thanks for dropping by and feel free to contact via **andrewminjolee@gmail.

item.title: Examining the Effects of I100S of CDHR3 Solubility in E.coli
item.description: Abstract Human rhinovirus is a virus that causes common cold illnesses. Rhinovirus C (RV-C), one of the three genetically distinct groups of rhinovirus, is mainly responsible for deadly illnesses such as asthma. On a molecular level, the expression of human protein Cadherin-related facility member (CDHR3), more specifically, its structural domain 1 and 2 are thought to be the binding sites for RV-C that is then introduced in our body. To determine the protein structure and its mechanism, purification can be done.

item.title: The "figure" Shortcode
item.description: Hugo has figure shortcode built in, so you can easily add figcaptions or hyperlink rel attributes to images. Documentations can be found here: https://gohugo.io/content-management/shortcodes/#figure This theme has 3 CSS classes made for figure elements: big: images will break the width limit of main content area. left: images will float to the left. right: images will float to the right. If a figure has no class set, the image will behave just like a normal markdown image: !

item.title: Post With Featured Image
item.description: Just define the image URL in the content‚Äôs front matter, the featured image will be displayed as the background. For example: ---images:-https://picsum.photos/1024/768/?random---This is an array, you can set multiple urls, only the first url will be used. These images is also used in Twitter Cards and the Open Graph metadata.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: Creating a New Theme
item.description: Introduction This tutorial will show you how to create a simple theme in Hugo. I assume that you are familiar with HTML, the bash command line, and that you are comfortable using Markdown to format content. I'll explain how Hugo uses templates and how you can organize your templates to create a theme. I won't cover using CSS to style your theme. We'll start with creating a new site with a very basic template.
